settings.section_general_intro: The base settings required for the extension to work.
settings.section_sso_intro: This feature will seamlessly connects Wordpress users with Flarum. An account will automatically be created for them and kept in sync with Wordpress. If you have existing accounts in Flarum, they will automatically be matched by their email. If you delete a user in Flarum, it will be created again next time the Wordpress account logins. To block a Flarum user, suspend the account in Flarum.
settings.cookie_domain_help: Only necessary if different from Flarum domain
settings.wordpress_login_path_help: Only necessary if you renamed your login endpoint manually or via a plugin
settings.username_strategy_help: A number will be appended to the username if it already exists in Flarum
settings.force_username_choice: Make users choose their username on first visit
settings.force_username_choice_help: A default value will be provided with the rule chosen above.
settings.welcome_message_help: This message will be shown the first time the user visits the forum, together with the username choice if enabled.
settings.wordpress_login_only_help: Disables Flarum login and directly opens Wordpress login modal when login is required. This will automatically set the "Sign Up" permission to Closed.
settings.user_delete: Action when a user is deleted in Wordpress

user_delete_options.suspend: Suspend Flarum user indefinitely (Suspend extension must be enabled)

settings.user_delete_desc: If you select "delete", only the user will be deleted, not their content on Flarum.
settings.section_comments_intro: This feature replaces Wordpress comments with a Flarum iframe. Guest posting is no longer possible. Discussions are only created for posts with comments enabled in Wordpress. Enabling or disabling comments is synced with Flarum's discussion lock. If your blog already contains posts when you enable this feature, you need to enable and disable comments again on each article for the Flarum discussion to be created.
settings.excerpt_html_whitelist: Whitelist of HTML tags to keep in the excerpt (comma separated)
settings.excerpt_html_nodes: Length of the content excerpt (in number of HTML nodes)
settings.excerpt_length: Length of the content excerpt (in characters)
settings.summary_as_last_post: Set the summary post as the last post of new discussions
settings.summary_as_last_post_help: This makes new comment discussions rise to the top of the discussion list in Flarum as soon as the Wordpress post is published. By default the discussion would only rise to the top once a first user wrote a comment.
settings.use_post_date: Use Wordpress post date as the discussion creation date
settings.use_post_date_help: By default Flarum discussions will use the current time as their creation date. This option allows creating discussions with a past date if the Wordpress post also has a past date.
settings.post_hide: Action when a Wordpress post is hidden (trashed or moved to draft)

post_hide_options.ignore: Ignore (lock discussion according to Allow Comments)

settings.post_delete: Action when a Wordpress post is deleted permanently

post_delete_options.ignore: Ignore (keep Flarum discussion in current state)
